quest.name: To Have Loved and Lost
journal: Sul Oul is eager to hear what Granson has to say.

Having taken ample time to consider the nature of the man Branden was, and the man Granson had convinced himself he must be, the hunter has at last accepted the simple truth: that a hardened heart full of hate is ultimately empty. There is naught to be gained from playing the part of a vengeful hero, for there are only victims in his story. And so he must bring an end to the tale and lay Milinda and Branden's spirits to rest...and then move on. Satisfied that Granson has at last turned away from the brink, Sul Oul reveals the location of the Claws of Orthus, and furnishes you with a satchel of powder to dispel the glamour that shields it from view.

After coming to the designated location in Timh Gyeus, you cast the powder into the air with a flourish, which settles to reveal the hidden coffer. Granson kneels and withdraws the Claws of Orthus, and as if on cue, Dikaiosyne appears to claim his prize, and the battle is joined.

Though your enemy is formidable indeed, together you and Granson manage to lay the fallen Warrior of Light low. As he begins to fade into motes of aether, Branden seems to regain a fragment of his lost self, as he reflects on perhaps the most painful decision of his life. To your surprise, however, you learn that like Granson, he managed to reject the mistaken belief that he need forsake compassion and love to move on, and instead chose to embrace it, that he might honor the memory of the lady Sauldia.

Sul Oul is relieved to hear that Branden's soul is at peace...and that the turmoil in Granson's heart has subsided as well. With the deed done, the hunter has no need for the royal relics of Voeburt, and so he entrusts them to the former retainer that they may be enshrined in the fallen kingdom forevermore.

Having returned to the Crystarium, his hunt at an end, Granson turns his thoughts to the future, and realizes that he no longer feels at home there or in Wright or anywhere else. The road shall host him for the time being, as he believes that someone, somewhere must surely be in need of a reliable sword hand. Though your time together is at an end, there is no reason to think you will not meet again, and so you bid farewell to each other...until the next hunt.
objectives: Use the mushroom powder to reveal the hidden coffer.
Speak with Sul Oul at Pla Enni.
Speak with Granson in the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Granson. I have given you ample time to consider the path that has brought you here...and where it invariably leads all who walk it.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: ...I didn't know what to do after I lost Milinda. How to mourn her or how to live. I felt...that if I put it all on Dikaiosyne, put my everything into the hunt, that at least I wouldn't have to think about myself, or what comes next.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: I wanted to hollow myself out...and fill up that hole with hate. Forget who I was. And irony of ironies, that's just what the poor bastard tried to do to himself a century ago, too, isn't it?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Heh. “Hard men” making hard choices... What rot.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Hold on to Milinda and the memories you shared. Let that love guide you.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Think not of Dikaiosyne, but Branden. Grant him peace and you will find your own.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: ...You're right. I don't need the hate. Never did. I'll finish it for Milinda...and for Branden. And then...I'll move on.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: ...Maybe. Still, that thing's no more than a mindless eater. Nothing it can say or do to make it right. So I'll finish the hunt...for Milinda...and for Branden. And then...I'll move on.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Ah, sorry. Having planted my head so far up my own arse, it's taking me time to remove it. Don't worry, I'll finish the hunt with you─but for the right reasons. For Milinda...and for Branden. And then...I'll move on.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: ...Move on, you say?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: I can't live off hate. Shouldn't've made it this far, frankly. And the more I try to reach for it, the more I find...sorrow? Pity?

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Curse not fate, but mourn her victims. Remember the dead as they lived.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Aye, something like that. Reckon Forename would agree. And Milinda, if she were here, would probably slap me a dozen times and call me a bloody fool for acting the way I have.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Or maybe you've been thinking about doing that in her stead, eh?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Apologies for treating you with such disrespect before, Sul Oul. I'd like to claim I finally understand what you've been trying to tell me all this time, but I'm still getting my head around it─

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Recognizing your faults is the first and most important step. I will tell you what I know of the Claws of Orthus.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: The ring, together with the bracelet and choker were three relics passed down through the royal family over generations, signifying the owner's right to rule.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Princess Sauldia was the last of her line, and after her death, they were stored in a sanctuary for safekeeping. However, a year ago, a band of thieves learned of its existence...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: The ones who stole the Fangs and Eyes of Orthus?

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Yes. The relics were concealed with magical wards. I can only presume that once they were spirited away, Dikaiosyne was then able to sense their presence.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Even in death, a slave to duty, you said? You think he pursued the thieves out of an instinctive loyalty to his princess?

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: That I do. After all, he was content to leave them be so long as they remained hidden.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Only two of the three were taken? Then the third is still─

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Claim the Claws of Orthus and he will surely come for you, yes.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Timh Gyeus is where you must go. Once you arrive at the place I marked on your map, cast this powder into the air. The glamour will fade, and you will see the chest with the ring. The rest is up to you.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Thank you, Sul Oul. I promise we will bring your friend peace.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: With me, sinner!

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: And may you find peace as well, child...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You toss the powder into the air, and as it slowly settles to the earth as twinkling motes of light, a coffer begins to take shape...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: This must be the Claws of Orthus.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: All that's left is to decide when and where we want to confront the eater...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Or we could deal with it here and now. Speak of the devil and he shall appear...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Hey there, old man. I don't know you, and you don't know me...but I know your story. I know this isn't you. And I know that if Lady Sauldia was here, she'd say the same thing...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: It'll all be over soon. I promise you...

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Go to the place I marked on your map, and there use the powder in the satchel to dispel the glamour concealing the coffer. You will find the ring within.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Come! Let's put the poor bastard out of his misery!

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: What the─ Did he do that!?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Well that's hardly fair! Hold on, sinner!

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: This is surprisingly complicated... Still with me?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Something doesn't smell right. Stand back!

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Tough ol' bastard, isn't he? But I'm no slouch myself...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Oh, come on! Not again!

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Looks like it's my turn. I'm counting on you, sinner!

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Wicked white, I felt that one. Thanks!

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Milinda. I tried...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> Damn eater...let him go! He's not your bloody puppet!

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Heh, finally... You watching, Milinda?

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: (-Branden's Shade-)Now...and ever after, my lady Sauldia... My sword is yours...to command...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Branden? He's still in there?

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: (-Branden's Shade-)I'll not hesitate again. No matter the cost─no matter the sacrifice...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: ...Wait. Is he trapped in the memory still?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: You're wrong, Branden! That's not what she would want! Let go of your anger! Let go of her!

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: (-Branden's Shade-)...But that would make me lesser in your eyes, wouldn't it? To shoulder a burden that need not be mine. No. I will not forsake compassion and love. I will not dishonor your memory.

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: (-Branden's Shade-)Oh, my lady Sauldia...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: ...He's gone.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: And with that, the three treasures of the royal family are reunited. Now we've just got to find a place to stick them so that no scavenger ever stumbles upon them again.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Least we can do for the princess and her knight, am I right?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Maybe Sul Oul will have some ideas. Let's head back to Pla Enni.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: This should be the place. You've got the powder on you, right?

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: It is done? Branden has been laid to rest?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: You saw us when we arrived. Do you really have to ask?

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: No, I suppose not. Oh, my dear friend...I pray you have found peace.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: And what of you, Granson? Has the turmoil in your heart subsided at last?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Aye, I suppose so...though, to be honest, it felt like I made my peace with him before we even fought...

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Because you finally saw him for what he was, and accepted that truth into your heart. The battle was but an afterthought.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Hah! Easy for you to say. You didn't have to cross blades with the bloke.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: By the way─I've brought you some gifts.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: The three royal relics of Voeburt! Then Branden was safeguarding both the bracelet and the choker...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: And now it's your turn to look after the whole lot. That's what Lady Sauldia and her knight would've wanted, I reckon.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Yes, of course... That their souls may sleep soundly forevermore, we shall enshrine these relics for all eternity...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Now that that's settled, I suppose we should be on our way. There's a detour I'll have to take, but afterwards I'd like to speak with you back at the usual spot in the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Be well, Sul Oul.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: I think that one has a bright life ahead of him. Few can find the strength to overcome such terrible tragedy, but he did.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: As have you, on no few occasions, I am sure.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: It has been a pleasure, Forename. Do visit me should you ever yearn to hear an old fool prattle on and on.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: After you, Forename.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Well met, sinner. Glad to see you made it back safe and sound.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Having returned to where it all began, I can't help but think back to when I first came here, thinking only of Dikaiosyne and my revenge. I was so wrapped up in my own personal affairs that I didn't realize I was only pushing others away...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Glynard was the only one who saw through the facade. He's a perceptive one, aye─took one look at me when I got back and broke into a smile.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: But enough about him─I have yet to thank you properly, Forename! I owe you so much for sticking with me to the end...

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: So what's next for you, sinner?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Good question. Can't say I feel at home here or in Wright or anywhere else, so I might spend some time on the road. I may not be as skilled a fighter as you, but I reckon I'm better than most, and there's always someone in need of a reliable sword hand.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: What? At a loss for words? You? Or are you getting misty-eyed at the thought of us parting ways? I'll still be around, you know.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Not here, though. Can't say I feel at home in the Crystarium or in Wright or anywhere else, so I might spend some time on the road. I may not be as skilled a fighter as you, but I reckon I'm better than most, and there's always someone in need of a reliable sword hand.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Milinda would want me to use my talents for a noble purpose, and helping folks in need fits the bill. Hells, isn't that what Branden and his comrades wound up doing in the end?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: So─let's not call it a good-bye. Let's just say...until the next hunt.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Wheresoever you go, may you find shade, sinner.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: ...Oh? You wish to listen to my ramblings now? Nay, I think not. Another time, Forename, another time.

obj.n: Once, Twice, Three Times a Warrior
